title: Printing puzzles from USA Today
content: When printing puzzles from USA Today on my Canon Maxify, the crossword puzzle and the sudoku both show up as two pages, when they are only one each. If I don't change the setting from All to Current each time, it will print a blank page with each puzzle. This just started happening within the last month or two, but I have had Firefox/Duck Duck Go for many years. If I switch my browser and search engine to Google, which I hate, it shows and prints each puzzle properly. I don't know if it's the browser or the search engine, but it is a problem that I didn't have until recently. The print box is completely different from Firefox/Duck Duck Go to Google, so if it is Duck Duck Go that sets the printing box, I need to contact them. Firefox version 147.0 on Windows 10 on Lenovo laptop. Thanks in advance to anyone with a solution.

title: Firefox 147.0, macOS 15.7.3, site breakages, Javascript errors
content:
Hi, The site https://fortunenette.fr/ does not display properly in Firefox on my MacBook Pro running macOS 15.7.3 (build 24G419).

The header and navigation load fine, but the biography articles and the richest people table stay blank or show only placeholders. In the Firefox Console I see these errors: Uncaught TypeError reading 'length' of undefined, mixed content blocks for HTTP resources on an HTTPS page, and several CSP violations for inline scripts.

I already cleared cache and cookies, disabled all extensions, tried Private Browsing, turned off Enhanced Tracking Protection, and changed some about:config settings like strict transport security. Nothing helped.

The site loads perfectly in Safari and Chrome on the same Mac. It happens in Firefox 147.0 and the 148.0b2 beta too.

It seems like a Gecko-specific JavaScript or rendering problem. Has anyone else run into this? Any workaround without switching browsers?

title: Firefox 147.0.1 Won't Launch Soon After Setting Up Profiles
content:
New laptop. Installed Firefox. Set up 2 of the "new" type profiles. Typical extensions (Bitwarden, Bit.ly, Firefox Color). Not too long after, Firefox will no longer launch and the only remediation I've found is to do a clean uninstall/reinstall including deleting registry keys. I've now done this three times now. Environment information

  • i7 Core Ultra/32GB RAM
  • SentinelOne - Corporate Environment. Installs Firefox Extension. There are no signs in the S1 portal or client that it is blocking firefox.
  • nVIDIA RTX PRO 500 Blackwell Video Card. Updated to current driver 582.16
  • Threatlocker - Computer is new and has been in "Learning Mode" so it isn't an issue
  • Tailscale runs on this machine, but it doesn't seem to make a difference if it is running.

Nothing in the %APPDATA% crash reports folder for firefox. Crash dumps for firefox are in %LOCALAPPDATA%/CrashDumps. One read by AppCrashView is attached. It is a 0xc0000005 Access violation in StackHash_2264.

This is a problem where renaming the firefox.exe to firefox1.exe will get it to run but it seems to lose track of profiles.

Firefox is my favorite browser and I'd like to resolve this, but I really can't afford spending much more time on it or continually clean reinstalling and rebuilding profies. I've seen other similar posts, but no clear resolution.
creator: tmedler

title: There are some inconveniences in use...
content:
1. The browser's built-in full page translation function has poor translation performance, even far lower than other browser functions.

2. The font modification in the settings cannot take effect on the translated page font. For example, when opening a literature page (Elsevier) and clicking on the built-in full page translation, the font does not change.

3. When the page becomes a fixed tab, the prompts before closing multiple tabs will become invalid, and clicking the close button will close all tabs without prompts.

It should be pointed out that the loading speed of this browser is very fast. I feel that using this browser fully utilizes the performance of my computer, rather than some browsers that use a new era CPU and GPU, but the loading speed is the same as more than a decade ago. In addition, this browser has highly personalized features that meet my needs. It would be even better if the above issues could be resolved.

Thanks a lotÔºÅ

title: Profiles from about:profiles are missing and not transferable to the new Profiles menu
content:
I‚Äôm running into a limitation with Firefox profiles involving the original Profile Manager (about:profiles) and the new Profiles menu in the toolbar.

I previously created multiple profiles using the original Profile Manager (about:profiles), for example profiles A, B, and C. These profiles still function normally and can be launched through about:profiles, but they do not appear in the new Profiles menu in the toolbar.

I also tried using the ‚ÄúCopy this profile‚Äù option available from the new Profiles menu. This made it clear that the feature does not work with profiles created via about:profiles. For example, when I open profile A, I expected that I could use ‚ÄúCopy this profile‚Äù to copy profile A into an existing profile like profile B (which was also created using about:profiles). However, this is not possible. Profiles A, B, and C remain isolated from the new Profiles menu and cannot be accessed, copied, or managed through it.

At the moment, profiles created with the original Profile Manager (about:profiles) can only be accessed through that manager and cannot be transferred into the new Profiles menu in the toolbar.

Is there an official fix or a workaround that achieves the same result‚Äîspecifically, transferring or integrating all existing profiles created with the original Profile Manager (about:profiles) into the new Profiles menu accessible from the Firefox toolbar?
